useEnumInitializers.description:
Description

Require that each enum member value be explicitly initialized.
TypeScriptenums are a practical way to organize semantically related constant values.
Members of enums that donâ€™t have explicit values are by default given sequentially increasing numbers.
When the value of enum members are important,
allowing implicit values for enum members can cause bugs if enum declarations are modified over time.
useEnumInitializers.option: This rule has no specific options.
